result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan James Nilan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court notes 3 days credit on any ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Court will impose the DNA surcharge only.
Defendant to meet with the payment clerk.

-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Rhonda B.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson, ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: John A Kucinski DF: Donovan James Nilan appeared in custody. Case called at 10:50. Includes 17CF109, 15CM712, 16CM18, 17CF24. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. NG. Waives speedy trial. Atty. Kucinski updates the court on 15CM712, he would like to resolve 15CM712 today. ADA Nieskes responds. Atty. Kucinski argues. 
On 15CM712  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to 15CM712. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 15CM712. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
1 years probation with conditions: 
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rhonda B. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- Costs of $243.00 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge $200.00.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and any recommended follow through. 

Court notes 3 days credit on any ultimate sentence. 

Court will find the DE is unable to pay and will impose only the DNA surcharge. 
Court waives the domestic surcharge. 

DE to meet with the payment clerk.

**AMENDED**

- Comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Rhonda B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
